chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gene R. Balthazor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with victims family.
Defendant shall have no contact with any child under the age of 18 without Department of Corrections approval.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations, including sex offender treatment.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall comply with the sex offender registry.
Defendant shall not have employment or volunteer services that involve minors.
Defendant shall not possess body armor.
